s.text: "We are well placed to win a trade war with the French if they do not see sense," it said.
This referred to a decision by some British supermarket chains to ban French produce.
"The unravelling of the billions of coded sequences in human DNA (the chemical base of all genes) is expected to revolutionise medicine, and pave the way to genetically based cures," the paper said.
Rejecting calls for an official British ban on French food imports, the paper nevertheless urged consumers to buy British.

French newspapers reported Monday that Jiang spent three hours at dinner discussing human rights issues with French President Jacques Chirac, but Jiang told Le Figaro in an interview Monday that "in every country human rights should be managed by its own government in full independence" and that the Chinese government opposed any foreign interference in its internal affairs.
